terms.definition: In English, வேற்றுமை means 'difference'. Here, வேற்றுமை is the one which is going to differentiate the nouns
terms.description: To differentiate the nouns, some parts are attached to the nouns. These parts are called உருபு. There are eight வேற்றுமைகள் available in Tamil.

terms.definition: The noun appears as predicate without any change or attachments
terms.description:
Examples: இராமன் படித்தான், இராமன் அரசன், இராமன் யார்?. The meanings are 'Raman read', 'Raman is/was a king' and 'Who is/was Raman?'

Eventhough there are no உருபு attached to this வேற்றுமை, modern language attach ஆனவன், என்பவன், என்பது as attachments. Example : இராமன் என்பவன் அரசன்.
